intro: Pistacia khinjuk var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the Indian chilgoza, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Himalayan regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, spiny fruits. The plant produces edible nuts encased in a hard, woody shell, which are harvested for culinary and medicinal use. It thrives in arid and semi-arid climates, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The tree is also valued for its ornamental features and traditional uses in local communities.
